summary: Email chain between Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys and Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey regarding a planned DOJ visit to Maxwell at MDC and the status of a replacement hard drive containing discovery materials. The defense insists no DOJ representatives should speak with Maxwell without counsel present and expresses concern over delays in receiving discovery.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The client of the defense attorneys, incarcerated at MDC, awaiting discovery materials on a hard drive and subject to a potential DOJ visit.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who emails the U.S. Attorney's office to raise concerns about a DOJ visit and the delayed delivery of a discovery hard drive.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Prosecutor from the Southern District of New York corresponding with Maxwell's defense team about the DOJ visit and the status of the discovery drive.

persons.name: Holly Pratesi
persons.context: Recipient of emails from Maurene Comey, likely at the detention facility (MDC), asked to check on the drive delivery and inquire about the DOJ visit.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Copied on Christian Everdell's email to the U.S. Attorney's office as part of Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Copied on Christian Everdell's email to the U.S. Attorney's office as part of Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Copied on Christian Everdell's email to the U.S. Attorney's office as part of Maxwell's defense team.

connections.description: Everdell is communicating on behalf of his client Maxwell regarding her legal rights and access to discovery materials.
Comey is the prosecuting attorney handling the case against defendant Maxwell.
Cohen is part of Maxwell's defense legal team, copied on key correspondence.
Adversarial correspondence between defense attorney and prosecutor regarding case logistics and defendant's rights.

events.title: Replacement Hard Drive Sent
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's office sent a replacement hard drive containing discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Hard Drive Delivered
events.description: The replacement discovery hard drive was delivered to the detention facility (MDC).

events.title: Planned DOJ Visit to MDC
events.description: Maxwell informed her attorneys that DOJ representatives planned to meet with her at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC); the defense objected to any meeting without counsel present.

locations: St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team raised an urgent concern about planned DOJ representatives visiting her at MDC without her attorneys present.
There was a significant delay in Maxwell receiving discovery materials, with a replacement hard drive sent on September 3rd not confirmed as received until September 9th.
The defense emphasized that the discovery deadline of August 21 had passed, impairing Maxwell's ability to participate in her defense.
The email chain shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office (Maurene Comey) and MDC staff (Holly Pratesi) to resolve logistical issues.
The correspondence highlights the tense attorney-client privilege and access issues in Maxwell's pre-trial detention.
